```{r setup}
library(RosaMATH5793lab7)
```

# Introduction

This package contains three functions which help in identifying data normality. We will explore each function with the included data sets.

# `propnorm()`

```{r}
facts <- c("Gender", "Socio")
propnorm(t46, facts)
```

This function analyzes the data for univariate and multivariate normality.

# `statdist()`

```{r}
statdist(cars, 0.5)
```

This function delves further into multivariate normality checks.

# `myboxcox`

```{r}
x <- t41$Radiation
myboxcox(x = x)
```

This function maximizes the log-likelihood for $\widehat{\lambda}_{MLE}$.
